intro: Erechtites glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered eupatorium, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant features tall, slender stems with opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs in late summer to early fall, producing clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
